Reviews.Content: Very good/excellent hotel. I got this hotel on priceline for $100 a night for a weekend stay. Which for the quality of the hotel and being in Los Angeles, you can't beat the value. I did a lot of research trying to find the right hotel for the right price. I was a little disappointed when I got this hotel on priceline due to the location, but I quickly changed my mind upon arrival. The staff is top notch. The rooms are great. Coffee downstairs in the morning. Sunday morning paper at my door. Car service to the surrounding area. Fox studios right next door. We were given a king on the 14th floor. Great room. Large bathroom. Comfortable king size bed. It had two floor to ceiling windows with a walk out patio!!! The patio was the size of the motel 6 room we stayed up the coast in. Seriously, two lounge chairs, table, and two sun chairs, on the large patio overlooking Beverly Hills, Downtown, Hollywood, and all the surrounding hills. You could see the Hollywood sign from our balcony on a clear morning. Very quiet up that high too. We stayed in room 1411. I would highly suggest room 1411, or maybe just a little better than that, room 1407. Only drawbacks. $30 valet only hotel parking. Was 30% of my room rate. But, very convenient and fast. And to a lesser extent. Location. There is nothing immediately around the hotel. No neighborhood. Beverly Hills is just a few streets away by car, but nothing you really want to walk to. But, if this hotel were right in the middle of one of the trendy neighborhoods, you wouldn't be getting it for $100 a night on priceline either. I would stay here again for sure. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Overall. Could Use Small Attention to Detail.”
Reviews.Author: leclaire68
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental Century City is, by most standards, quite comfortable and classy. As previous posts have mentioned, the hotel isn't really walking distance to anything of any significance. There is a shopping mall and grocery store (Gelson's) about three blocks away, though. Convenient to the 405 and 10 freeways, I found the hotel to be in a pretty accessible area of the metro L.A. area. A car would definitely be necessary when staying at this property. Be warned, though: parking is by valet only (as far as I could tell) and is $30/night. My room overlooked the front of the hotel and had a spectacular view of Hollywood and downtown L.A. in the distance. I was very impressed with the view and the double sliding glass doors opening onto a rather large and fairly nicely appointed balcony. The room interior was fairly large and decently appointed. The bed mattress was somewhat firm, but comfortable, and the bedding was of a high quality. The room's desk was adequate, but the desk chair was a stiff back chair that you might find at a dining table ... not the greatest for serious work. An armchair in the room was quite comfortable. The bathroom was large with, as noted in previous posts, separate shower and tub. A single vanity was sufficient for me as I was traveling alone, but a double vanity might have been more appropriate for a hotel of this class. Public areas at the hotel are first rate. I was very pleased to find that hotel guests have free access to the steam and saunas in the locker rooms for the hotel's spa. Outfitted with lush robes, heavy towels, bottled water, and pleasant lighting, I found this to be a nice perk. Overall, I think this hotel warrants its 4-star rating. There are some items that need some attention, though. These are minor issues, but for a hotel to truly be a 4-star property, they are items that I believe should not be overlooked: 1) The TV, bedside radio, and cordless telephones are very dated. They looked out of place and gave the impression of deferred maintenance. 2) There were stains (blood?) on the bedside lamp shade. They were quite apparent and covered the shade, top to bottom, on one portion of it. Something like that probably would go unreplaced in a Best Western or Holiday Inn, but should be removed in an Intercontinental. 3) The sheets were haphazardly applied. The bottom sheet was bunched up in the center of the bed. It wasn't anything that was that big of a deal ... just something that seemed odd. I'll definitely stay at this property again. While not perfect, it is very, very good and also a pretty good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great LA stay”
Reviews.Author: tarzanldy
Reviews.Content: This was our first Hotwire experience and what an amazing hotel for the price! The Intercontinental took over this hotel at the first of the year as it had previously been the Park Hyatt and JW Marriott. It is a lovely property in the heart of Century City. It is more of a business hotel due to its location, however, the hotel has a complimentary car service that will take you to the CC Shopping Center and nearby Rodeo Drive. The concierge staff is so knowledgeable and offered many suggestions. The pool area was well maintained with continual attention by the housekeeping staff. The rooms are comfortable with a great view of the city and the Hollywood hills.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Danni0005
Reviews.Content: Traveling with a girlfriend for a shopping weekend. Hotel was very nice--not really "hip" but a nice decent place to stay. Booked at a great rate, so I was happy. Bell staff is GREAT. Front desk staff is SNOBBY. Waitied over an hour ++ for late night room service. Housekeeping "forgot" to clean room both days. Had to call 4x for fresh towels. Room service food not very good and VERY expensive. Room had a nice view and great patio. Was double charged each night for valet parking. Was over charged on mini bar but they claim there was nothing i could do as the "bill" was closed and I had to call acctg (huh?). If they needed the extra $$ that bad..... It was "ok." I would stay here again if I got a great rate but would never pay more than $200.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, bad location for tourist!”
Reviews.Author: smes1102
Reviews.Content: As a tourist, the location of this hotel was horrible. Nothing is within walking distance (restaurants, tourist stuff, etc) so if you don't have a car, you'll have to take a cab everywhere. The hotel restaurant was very nice, but for the price of it -- get out and eat somewhere trendy on Sunset Blvd. The room and bathroom were both very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel- Great Price”
Reviews.Author: miller6565
Reviews.Content: Wanted to stay near Venice Beach but my wife is the boss. Got the room on priceline for Friday and Saturday for $105 a night. Was traveling with a tween. The pool looked nice but it was almost empty. The workout area was above average. They upgraded us to a nice suite. It had two TVs so it made my daughter happy. It is less than 2 miles from Beverly Hills. So my girls loved the location with being near a great mall and near rodeo drive. It is in a business area, but a short drive away from everything. I was surprise that this was ranked the 4th best hotel by TA when we booked. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Boring Location. Super Excellent Chocolate Shakes.”
Reviews.Author: LB1488
Reviews.Content: Went to LA for a little romantic getaway, however, I am young(ish) and poor so I suffered the whims of Priceline and came up with the Intercontinental. Neither a jackpot nor a disappointment (particularly when you're not paying anywhere near rack rate). The Pros? Very clean, *huge* bathrooms (separate tub and shower), lovely beds, friendly room service, and excellent facilities (we made great use of both the pool and the gym). The Cons? The location - downtown LA is good in that it's central, but there is *nothing* worthwhile nearby and as you'd expect, takes *forever* to drive anywhere in LA. This spot would be better fit for business travelers than tourists really. Valet parking - you can not park your own car. Annoying. Room service - while it definitely was a super chocolate milkshake - the room service menu is off-the-charts price-wise (and this is coming from a New Yorker, I'm used to big bills). Plus even though a tip is calculated into your bill, the wait staff clearly expects to be tipped in addition to that amount. Sigh. My final entertaining story: we got in late, checked in and wearily headed to our room. Only to open the door and find... someone asleep, who we clearly scared the [--] out of. Had I been a savvier traveler I would have brokered that into an upgrade. However, I was too tired - so I just trudged back down to the lobby to ask for another room. Which was quickly supplied.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - Terrible Rude Service”
Reviews.Author: zeka
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed just one night at the intercontinental. we each had a laptop computer. They info on the desk says that they charge $10 for "1 day" of internet use, which most hotels do nowadays so we paid ten bucks - using my boyfriend's laptop - for the one night we were staying here. At 11pm I attempted to get online using MY laptop instead and was prompted to pay again. Assuming this was a technical glitch I called the front desk -- and was informed by a rude and contrite young man - who said he was the manager - that the service the hotel used charged for each IP address... so if you used a different computer you would be charged ANOTHER ten dollars for the SAME 24 hrs of internet access. When I explained that clearly this was a technical glitch- i was informed that there was nothing to be done about it. If you use more than one computer in your room, you will pay $10 for EACH computer. Ridiculous. Never in my life has a purported four star hotel made that kind of "too bad for you" statement. Poor poor service. Extremely rude and disrespectful. And false advertising to boot. stay away.

HotelInfo.Name: InterContinental Los Angeles Century City
HotelInfo.Address: 2151 Avenue of the Stars, Los Angeles, CA 90067 (Formerly Park Hyatt Hotel)
